title: Data source
description:
Globaly unique identification of a data source.

The catalog of valid data sources is owned by AAM. Some identifiers are
reserved and have been assigned to the Solutions or to a thirdparty
(Twitter, iOS IDFS, People Device Graph, etc...) but new identifiers can be
created on demand by AAM to represent customerâ€™s data sources.

See also [AAM Data Source API](https://bank.demdex.com/portal/swagger/index.html#!/Data_Source_API/).

id.description: Globaly unique identifier of the data source.

tags.description:
Tags are used to indicate how the aliases represented by a given data
source should be interpreted by applications using those aliases.

Examples:

* `isAVID`: data sources representing Analytics visitor IDs.
* `isCRSKey`: data sources representing aliases that should be used as keys in CRS.

Tags are set when the data source is created but they are also included in
pipeline messages when referencing a given data source.
